titleInfo.title: USA v. Wirth
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL - IT IS ORDERED that Joseph L. Howard is appointed as attorney of record for the above-named defendant in this matter and shall forthwith file an appearance in this matter. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Federal Public Defenders Office shall forthwith provide counsel with a draft appointment order (CJA Form 20) bearing the name and other identifying information of the CJA Panel attorney identified in accordance with the Criminal Justice Act Plan for this district. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that counsels appointment herein is made pursuant to 18 U.S.C. ยง 3006A(f). At the time of the entry of judgment herein, defendant shall file a current and complete financial statement to aid the court in determining whether any portion of counsels fees and expenses should be reimbursed by defendant. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Clerk shall provide a copy of this order to the Federal Public Defender for the District of Nebraska and Joseph L. Howard.Joseph L. Howard for Richard Wirth appointed as counsel as to defendant(s) Richard Wirth Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken.(PCV, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL - IT IS ORDERED that Joseph L. Howard is appointed as attorney of record for the above-named defendant in this matter and shall forthwith file an appearance in this matter. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Federal Public Defenders Office shall forthwith provide counsel with a draft appointment order (CJA Form 20) bearing the name and other identifying information of the CJA Panel attorney identified in accordance with the Criminal Justice Act Plan for this district. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that counsels appointment herein is made pursuant to 18 U.S.C. ยง 3006A(f). At the time of the entry of judgment herein, defendant shall file a current and complete financial statement to aid the court in determining whether any portion of counsels fees and expenses should be reimbursed by defendant. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Clerk shall provide a copy of this order to the Federal Public Defender for the District of Nebraska and Joseph L. Howard.Joseph L. Howard for Richard Wirth appointed as counsel as to defendant(s) Richard Wirth Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken.(PCV, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Wirth
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - IT IS ORDERED: The government's motion for detention of Richard Wirth pursuant to the Bail Reform Act is held in abeyance pending the defendant's coming into federal custody. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED: The defendant, Richard Wirth, having received notice of his return to the custody of Nebraska state authorities pending the disposition of this matter and having waived an opportunity for hearing in this matter pursuant to the Interstate Agreement on Detainers, 18 U.S.C. app ยง 9(2), the U.S. Marshal is authorized to return the defendant, Richard Wirth, to the custody of Nebraska state authorities pending the final disposition of this matter and the U.S. Marshal for the District of Nebraska is directed to place a detainer with the correctional officerhaving custody of the defendant as to defendant Richard Wirth. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken.(PCV, )(cc to US Marshal)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER - IT IS ORDERED: The government's motion for detention of Richard Wirth pursuant to the Bail Reform Act is held in abeyance pending the defendant's coming into federal custody. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED: The defendant, Richard Wirth, having received notice of his return to the custody of Nebraska state authorities pending the disposition of this matter and having waived an opportunity for hearing in this matter pursuant to the Interstate Agreement on Detainers, 18 U.S.C. app ยง 9(2), the U.S. Marshal is authorized to return the defendant, Richard Wirth, to the custody of Nebraska state authorities pending the final disposition of this matter and the U.S. Marshal for the District of Nebraska is directed to place a detainer with the correctional officerhaving custody of the defendant as to defendant Richard Wirth. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken.(PCV, )(cc to US Marshal)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Wirth
titleInfo.subTitle: TENTATIVE FINDINGS regarding the Presentence Investigation Report as to Defendant Richard Wirth. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (JB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: TENTATIVE FINDINGS regarding the Presentence Investigation Report as to Defendant Richard Wirth. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (JB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Wirth
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Richard Wirth (1). The defendant plead guilty to count I of the Information and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a total term of 60 months to be served consecutive to any other sentence the defendant is currently serving; 3 years Supervised Release with special conditions; $100 Special Assessment; $66,278.27 Restitution to be paid jointly and severally with Raymond D. Hartz, Welsa Potts, Joshua Putman, Stacy Cook, Jean Long-Wirth and Joseph Young as to defendant Richard Wirth. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp.(MKR)4 cert to USM

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Wirth
titleInfo.subTitle: AMENDED JUDGMENT (Correction of Sentence on Remand) as to Richard Wirth (1). The defendant plead guilty to count I of the Information and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for 24 months; 3 years Supervised Release with special conditions; $100 Special Assessment (paid); and $66,278.27 Restitution (balance due of $62,670.63) to be paid jointly and severally with Raymond D. Hartz, Welsa Potts, Joshua Putman, Stacy Cook, Jean Long-Wirth and Joseph Young as to defendant Richard Wirth. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (1 Certified copy to USM) (JSF)
